subject: Stop me from being bad: Functional testing w/junit OK?
msgSnippet: Is it against the laws of nature to do something more then unit testing with junit? I have a heirarchy of objects that implement a common interface (an SPI if
messageBody:
Is it against the laws of nature to do something more then unit
testing with junit?

I have a heirarchy of objects that implement a common interface (an
SPI if you will). Each object has a "normal" life cycle that
consists of the following methods being called: beginFile(), print(),
endFile(). The result of these calls is a file generated on disk.

I guess that this is not unit testing because I'm not testing a
single method's actions. I want to call this sequence of methods and
then compare the generated files to golden masters.

FURTHERMORE, I'd like to use reflection to perform these steps on
each class in the heirarchy so it will automatically test new
implementations as they are added to the tree.

Is it inappropriate to use junit in this way? Is there a better way?

Thanks!
